result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L. Copus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With huber privileges.  Forthwith.  Submit to DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L. Copus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick L. Copus in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Patrick L. Copus in custody.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton advises matter is resolved.  Plea to Count 1.   State agrees with recommendation noted by Attorney Middleton.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
80 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber.  Forthwith.  35 days credit.  
DNA sample ordered.  
Paperwork handed in court.

Pre-trial conference at 07-24-2015 08:00 am.
Return date at 08-04-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Patrick L. Copus appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton and Intern, Josh Andreasen. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant has not yet applied.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $500 cash bond.  Several active warrant and lengthy warrant history.  Employed in Baraboo with ties to the community.  Request low cash bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
